text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm and as promised here is my wasabi
dipping sauce that i use for my
delicious california spring rolls and
like i said yesterday this is a great
all-purpose sauce dipping sauce for
almost anything pasta kurz anything it
starts with a wasabi and by the way if
you're still doing the wasabi Bud Light
thing from 12 years ago could you please
stop that it's not funny anymore alright
so there's a teaspoon of wasabi and by
the way if you watch Iron Chef you know
very well that's not real wasabi that's
just some horseradish but that's what we
got to use to the teaspoon of powdered
wasabi you're going to add a half a cup
of rice vinegar
okay I'm using the seasoned rice vinegar
I usually use the seasoned this got a
little salt a little sugar in it and
really nice kind of automatically
already sweet and sour condiment we're
going to add a teaspoon of this Asian
hot sauce you see me use a lot called
sriracha it's a it's hot sauce but it's
got a little bit of garlic and some
other things in it and then we're going
to add just a splash soy okay maybe a
teaspoon and a half now in the sushi
restaurant you're probably dipping your
California rolls just straight soy with
the wasabi in it but I want something a
little lighter here so give that a mix
that was with one teaspoon of wasabi and
I tasted that and you know what
it was warm okay it was it was kind of
hot but it didn't give me that kind of
sinus burning wasabi pleasure I was
looking for so I adjusted I added
another teaspoon of wasabi powder and I
mixed that in okay now again that's
going to look kind of grainy when you
first mix it in if you want to make a
paste first it dissolves a little easier
but I didn't want to bother because
after a few minutes sitting it will
dissolve and just keep mixing it well so
anyway there was my second teaspoon of
wasabi I tasted that and that was hot
okay that I could feel in the back of my
sinuses and it was nice but I still
wasn't happy because of what I was
really going for with this third
teaspoon
was that just searing painful nasal
sinus burning endorphin releasing wasabi
high that you we all get alright and by
the way I know you're not supposed to
put a lot of wasabi on your sushi you
ruin it well too bad that's how I like
it okay so I put three teaspoons of
wasabi in this it was hot it cleared my
sinuses it made me feel good okay so
anyway you adjust anywhere from 1
teaspoon to 6 teaspoons you decide and
again see how it looks kind of grainy
you give it a couple minutes it smoothes
out and you just whisk it up and you're
all set so there you go
it's very simple check the site for the
exact recipe amounts and again very
delicious with pot stickers things like
that anyway give that a try enjoy
